Description: Fragment of marble disc with round hole (Dm 1.4 cm) in the centre. On its centre the disc is 2.4 cm thick and 1.3 cm on its edges. The possibly under surface is even and slightly geared. The outer surface is smooth, likewise the upper side which moreover is slightly vaulted. Red paint is preserved in the circular space between the two inner circular scratches.
Curator's comments: Fragment B 433a is better preserved than B 433b. Due to its weight and the small central hole this fragment could have been, together with B 433b, a flywheel mass for tools (drill, lathe). If its context should be truly the Apollo temenos, this fragment could also be considered as a craftsman’s votive. The latter has three circle incised and not spirals, like Pryce suggests (Dm 4.4 cm, 7 cm, 9 cm). Published (Koenigs 2007, 343 Cat. 41a)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B433a)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.41, p.343)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.56) (Phase 3)
